snippet: NYU Langone Medical Center, responding to the death of Rory Staunton, 12, said it would make significant changes to the way it reviews data before releasing patients.
abstract: NYU Langone Medical Center in Manhattan says it will make significant changes to the way it reviews data before discharging patients in the wake of the death of 12-year-old Rory Staunton from septic shock after he was sent home; hospital has developed a new checklist to ensure that emergency doctors and nurses conduct a final review of all critical lab tests and vital signs before patients are released.
lead_paragraph: NYU Langone Medical Center, responding to the death of Rory Staunton, 12, said it would make significant changes to the way it reviews data before releasing patients.
